title: Strike Near Another Ukrainian Nuclear Plant Escalates Fears of Disaster
description: A powerful Russian missile hit 300 yards from the plant far from the front lines, Ukraine said, a reminder that despite its recent retreat, Russia can still threaten nuclear sites.

title: After Putin acknowledges Xi’s ‘concerns,’ Russia and China pledge closer cooperation.
O.S.C.E. condemns 13-year prison term for two staff members in occupied territory as ‘repugnant.’
Thousands Pay Tribute as Britain Says Final Farewell to Queen Elizabeth
description: More than 100 world leaders, including President Biden, attended the funeral for Queen Elizabeth II, and Britons lined the streets for a procession that took her to her final resting place at Windsor Castle.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Britain Buries Queen Elizabeth II
description: Plus a preview of the U.N. General Assembly and growing nuclear fears in Ukraine.

title: Earthquake Shakes Mexico on Anniversary of 2 Major Temblors
description: The magnitude 7.6 earthquake, centered near the boundary of Colima and Michoacan states, killed at least one person. It came on the same day as devastating quakes in 1985 and 2017.

title: In Parks and on Post Boxes, Crowds Say Farewell to the Queen
description: The death of Queen Elizabeth II brought droves of people together in central London, where mourning has distracted many from Britain’s political tumult and cost-of-living crisis.

title: Windsor, Queen’s Final Resting Place, Has a Long Association With Her
description: Queen Elizabeth spent much time as the castle outside London. Her husband is also buried there.

title: From Coronation to Funeral: Bookends to the Life of a Queen, and a Generation
description: For 70 years, Elizabeth II was the anchor of a nation’s identity. Charles III now will take on, or recast, that role.

title: In the eastern Donbas, a slew of contradictions.
Mexico Has Tequila. Peru, Pisco. In Colombia, a Push for Viche, Now Legal.
description: Invented by formerly enslaved people, viche, a cane sugar liquor, was long banned, a sort of Colombian moonshine. Now, it’s a symbol of the country’s often ignored Afro-Colombian culture.

title: In Ukraine, Glass Is a Precious Substance as Winter Looms
description: Russian bombs. Soaring energy costs. Severed trade links. It’s getting hard to fix all the shattered windows in Ukraine, and winter is coming.

title: United Nations: What to Expect at the General Assembly This Week
description: The session will feature top leaders in New York City in person for the first time in three years. But the tone will be one of crisis, not triumph.

title: Ukrainian officials try to build pressure to hold Russia accountable for war crimes.
McDonald’s Begins to Reopen Restaurants in Ukraine This Week
description: Three outlets will open in Kyiv for delivery, before a wider reopening in the capital and west of the country over the next two months.

title: U.S. Hostage Exchanged for Afghan Drug Lord in Prisoner Swap
description: The Taliban said it had freed an American engineer, Mark R. Frerichs, in exchange for the release of a prominent Afghan tribal leader convicted of drug trafficking.

title: Thousands Gather in Hyde Park to Watch Queen Elizabeth's Funeral
description: Tens of thousands of people gathered in the park in central London to watch Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral service.

title: Where Will the Queen Be Buried?
description: Queen Elizabeth II spent much of the pandemic at Windsor Castle. She will be interred in the King George VI Memorial Chapel, next to Prince Philip, her husband of 73 years.

title: Queen Elizabeth II Funeral: Coffin Procession Route in London
description: The funeral cortege is traveling from Westminster Abbey to Wellington Arch. Her coffin will then be moved to Windsor.

title: Crowds Gather in Windsor to Await the Arrival of the Queen’s Coffin
description: Queen Elizabeth II will be interred in St. George’s Chapel at Windsor Castle later on Monday.

title: Updates: Queen Elizabeth II’s Funeral Begins
description: Britain is paying its final respects to the nation’s longest-reigning monarch with processions and services in London and Windsor.

title: Democracy Challenged
description: Representative government faces its most serious threats in decades.

title: Ukraine Pushes for War Crime Prosecutions
description: Ukraine’s ambassador to Washington said evidence of “tortures, rapes, killings, war crimes of massive proportions” had been found.

title: Exhumations in Izium will continue for two more weeks, its mayor says.
Europe’s Energy Crisis Forces Factories to Go Dark
description: Manufacturers are furloughing workers and shutting down lines because they can’t pay the gas and electric charges.

title: Jenny Xie Explores the Subversive Power of the Concealed and the Overlooked
description: In her new poetry collection, “The Rupture Tense,” Xie peeks at the past — her family’s, and China’s — to examine the consequences of “how we see, what we see, and also what we allow to remain unseen.”

title: Jenny Xie Explores the Subversive Power of the Concealed and the Overlooked
description: In her new poetry collection, “The Rupture Tense,” Xie peeks at the past — her family’s, and China’s — to examine the consequences of “how we see, what we see, and also what we allow to remain unseen.”

title: Bus Taking People to Quarantine Crashes in China, Killing 27
description: The deaths renewed an anguished debate over the price of China’s “zero Covid” policy.

title: Widespread business and public service closures put Britain’s economy on hold.
Queen Elizabeth II Funeral: Schedule of Events for the Day
description: The funeral for Queen Elizabeth II will begin at 11 a.m. on Monday, followed by a procession across central London.

title: Guest List for Queen Elizabeth’s Funeral Includes Everyday Honorees
description: Among those invited to Queen Elizabeth II’s funeral are almost 200 people who were honored for various forms of public service this year.

title: How to Watch Queen Elizabeth II’s Funeral
description: The New York Times will feature a livestream of the main events.

title: The guest list for the queen’s funeral will include presidents and an emperor.
description: President Biden will be among the 2,000 mourners at the funeral for Queen Elizabeth II at Westminster Abbey.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Pressure on Russian forces in southern Ukraine.

title: Queen Elizabeth: A Visual Dictionary
description: The things that made the queen the queen.
